page.title: 07MOSS VALLEY, FIELDS & WOODS
page.content: The valley has not been as badly affected by agricultural change as some other areas and many plants and animals still find refuge in the peaceful landscape. Many of the remaining woods possibly date from the ice age and although many have been affected by man, some are still semi-natural with uncommon plants and animals like wild daffodil and badger. Some of the old grasslands are also of great age with innumerable wild flowers found only when they have not been ploughed or fertilised for several centuries. Please refer to page 6 for a report on the river habitat.
